textRun.content: WATCH: What Pennsylvania’s new $47.6 billion budget means for you
Live event: Learn how PA’s new budget benefits you
Spotlight PA hosted a free panel on Pennsylvania’s budget winners and losers.
Live event: Learn how PA’s new budget benefits you
Live event: Learn how PA’s new budget benefits you
Spotlight PA hosted a free panel on what did — and didn’t — make it into Pennsylvania’s new budget.
The exterior of the Pennsylvania Capitol in Harrisburg.
Spotlight PA Event: What Pennsylvania’s new $47.6 billion budget means for you
is an independent, nonpartisan, and nonprofit newsroom producing investigative and public-service journalism that holds power to account and drives positive change in Pennsylvania.
Sign up for our free newsletters
HARRISBURG — Lawmakers have finalized Pennsylvania’s new $47.6 billion budget — and no one is completely happy.
Democratic Gov. Josh Shapiro didn’t get recreational marijuana or a tax on skill games; legislative Democrats didn’t get a minimum wage increase; and legislative Republicans didn’t get tax cuts.
plenty made it into the final plan
sends $500 million to the state’s poorest schools
, funnels new dollars into economic development, and creates a new college scholarship program.
For more insight on the spending plan, Spotlight PA’s Capitol reporter Stephen Caruso is hosting a live panel.
Spotlight PA held a free panel discussion on the major components of the budget, the politics that shaped the deal, and what was left on the cutting room floor.
» Spotlight PA’s events operate on a “pay-what-you-can” honor system.
If you value this public-service event, pay it forward and contribute any amount to Spotlight PA now so we can keep our programming free for everyone:
